pull.title: Simplify ProcessGetBlockData execution by removing send flag
pull.body:
Rebased/nits fixed version of #13250.
> Setting the send flag to false can be replaced by simply returning.

events.body: Concept ACK, simplification is correct. Not sure about the new test.

I think it is somewhat subjective whether an early return is preferable to a status variable.

ACK on the test in any case.
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->No more conflicts as of last run.

verification.payload:
tree 8dc3f9ba94f51d2fcee6c2f1873ddbdcdf45ef68
parent 0df7a6c13ec484f9f31cfe3ed3039098a9bef124
author Patrick Strateman <patrick.strateman@gmail.com> 1526510960 -0700
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1534127180 +0800

net: Simplify ProcessGetBlockData execution by removing send flag.

Setting the send flag to false can be replaced by simply returning.

events.message:
net: Simplify ProcessGetBlockData execution by removing send flag.

Setting the send flag to false can be replaced by simply returning.

events.body: I've just dropped the test entirely here.

utACK 0cf546f71ebbee960fdca044e7abd100eec7b688 ...

... as long as these horrible single line if statements with multiple
nested parens are cleaned up soon after

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,32 @@

+"""Request non-existent block.
+"""
+
+from test_framework.mininode import *
+from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+from test_framework.util import *

@@ -0,0 +1,32 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2018 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Request non-existent block.

+
+from test_framework.mininode import *
comments.body:
Specify:
```py
from test_framework.mininode import (CInv, P2PInterface, msg_getdata)
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,31 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2018 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Request non-existent block.
+"""
+
+from test_framework.mininode import CInv, P2PInterface, msg_getdata
+from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+
+# TestP2PConn: A peer we use to send messages to bitcoind, and store responses.
+class TestP2PConn(P2PInterface):
+    def __init__(self):
+        super().__init__()
comments.body: Doesn't seem like this subclass is necessary. Any reason you can't just use P2PInterface on line 23 below?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,31 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2018 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Request non-existent block.
+"""
+
+from test_framework.mininode import CInv, P2PInterface, msg_getdata
+from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+
+# TestP2PConn: A peer we use to send messages to bitcoind, and store responses.
+class TestP2PConn(P2PInterface):
+    def __init__(self):
+        super().__init__()

@@ -0,0 +1,26 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2018 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Request non-existent block.
+"""
+
+from test_framework.mininode import CInv, P2PInterface, msg_getdata
+from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+
+class InvalidGetDataTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
+    def set_test_params(self):
+        self.setup_clean_chain = True
+        self.num_nodes = 1
+
+    def run_test(self):
+        # Setup the p2p connections and start up the network thread.
+        self.test_node = self.nodes[0].add_p2p_connection(P2PInterface())
+
+        self.test_node.wait_for_verack()
+
+        self.test_node.send_message(msg_getdata(inv=[CInv(2, 0)]))
comments.body: What is this testing? I don't see any assertions.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,26 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2018 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Request non-existent block.
+"""
+
+from test_framework.mininode import CInv, P2PInterface, msg_getdata
+from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+
+class InvalidGetDataTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
+    def set_test_params(self):
+        self.setup_clean_chain = True
+        self.num_nodes = 1
+
+    def run_test(self):
+        # Setup the p2p connections and start up the network thread.
+        self.test_node = self.nodes[0].add_p2p_connection(P2PInterface())
+
+        self.test_node.wait_for_verack()
+
+        self.test_node.send_message(msg_getdata(inv=[CInv(2, 0)]))
comments.body: I think an earlier version of the code would crash when receiving such an inv. But yeah, somewhat agree that a new test file with all the overhead is a bit too much for testing so little
